channel.title: math.SP updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SP updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Spectral estimates for non-self-adjoint Dirac operators
item.description: arXiv:2504.02236v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The spectrum of a periodic non-self-adjoint Dirac operator is studied, and its explicit dependence on a semi-classical parameter is also considered. Using ``energy'' techniques several new estimates are derived that together confine the spectrum to a subset of the complex plane. Importantly, a sufficient condition is obtained which ensures that the spectrum concentrates on the real axis, and a bounded subset of the imaginary axis of the spectral variable as the semi-classical parameter tends to zero.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Oregero

item.title: Spectral asymmetry via pseudodifferential projections: the massless Dirac operator
item.description: arXiv:2504.02336v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: A new approach to the study of spectral asymmetry for systems of partial differential equations (PDEs) on closed manifolds was proposed in a recent series of papers by the first author and collaborator. They showed that information on spectral asymmetry can be encoded within and recovered from a negative order pseudodifferential operator -- the asymmetry operator -- constructed from appropriately defined pseudodifferential (spectral) projections. In this manuscript we apply these techniques to the study of the massless Dirac operator; in particular, we compute the principal symbol of the asymmetry operator, accounting for the underlying gauge invariance.
item.dc:creator: Matteo Capoferri, Beatrice Costeri, Claudio Dappiaggi

item.title: Behavior of Absorbing and Generating $p$-Robin Eigenvalues in Bounded and Exterior Domains
item.description: arXiv:2408.06236v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We establish rigorous quantitative inequalities for the first eigenvalue of the generalized $p$-Robin problem, for both the classical diffusion absorption case, where the Robin boundary parameter $\alpha$ is positive, and the superconducting generation regime ($\alpha<0$), where the boundary acts as a source. In bounded domains, we use a unified approach to derive a precise asymptotic behavior for all $p$ and all small real $\alpha$, improving existing results in various directions, including requiring weaker boundary regularity for the case of the classical 2-Robin problem, studied in the fundamental work by Ren\'e Sperb. In exterior domains, we characterize the existence of eigenvalues, establish general inequalities and asymptotics as $\alpha\to 0$ for the first eigenvalue of the exterior of a ball, and obtain some sharp geometric inequalities for convex domains in two dimensions.
item.dc:creator: Lukas Bundrock, Tiziana Giorgi, Robert Smits
